{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3162407,"name":"$. Jazzwal","username":"Jazzwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jazzwal/{size}/188242_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T22:40:40.075Z","cooked":"

Robot field relative keeps randomly switching ‚Äúforward‚Äù to the direction left of the robot (-90¬∞). It appears to be inconsistent, but generally occurs 5-15 seconds after dropping or picking up game pieces. We are using a Pigeon 2.0 and Swerve MK4i. Don‚Äôt know if this is related, but we also have been receiving a ‚ÄúCAN frame not received/too stale‚Äù error for the Pigeon, but have inspected all wiring, and even rerouted CAN wires to go from CANivore straight to the Pigeon first in case of a timeout issue but to no avail. We have contacted ctre, but were hoping to see if anyone else has been having the same issue to help resolve as quickly as possible considering our driving during competition is extremely difficult due to it happening randomly. Last competition was a doozy trying line it up, and it has been happening more and more frequently for some reason (10ish seconds between occurrences). Any assistance would be awesome:)

Jazzwal","username":"Jazzwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jazzwal/{size}/188242_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-11T22:58:13.944Z","cooked":"

I just reread this post and realized it probably sounds pretty confusingüòÖ in essence- robot is setting field relative to the robot‚Äôs left randomly (possibly an issue with the pigeon), with the frequency at which it happens being fairly random as well. Fairly certain it is not a wiring/wire issue as robot is still driving. Please let me know if you need any clarification.

We don‚Äôt see this, but this post will help explain the -90 issue‚Ä¶

CTRE Pigeon 2 always powers up with a Yaw of -90 Sensors
By any chance, in Robot Initialize, do you have the pigeon reset factory defaults as well as set it to 0.0? In this case however, it would also be a good idea to have a zeroing button to set the pigeons zero however way you are facing. Especially if you are working with Swerve Drive.

I wonder if you have a power issue that is causing the Pigeon to keep resetting. That would cause your stale frames also.
